data.title: Don't skip dessert
data.text: Family owned restaurant on PCH. limited free parking in front of restaurant. reasonable priced and good food. Don't skip dessert! Make sure you order the Tiramisu. recommended Meutermedia

data.title: #35 eatery in Carlsbad? Hard to understand - for us, it's #1 in the pizza department
data.text: Besides being less than a block away from where we stayed, their pizza IS TO DIE FOR. Period.  Awesome pies, great craft beers and stellar service made this place an excellent find for us while away.  If you're ever in Carlsbad, see the ocean sunset - of course - and then walk over to Jay's for a great pizza afterward, and if you like lager, have a Ballast Point Longfin with it. EXCELLENT!

data.title: Excellent food but too noisy
data.text: The food and service are excellent in this small local family restaurant but the acoustics were bad and it was very noisy which made it difficult to talk with my dining companion. If hearing is not a problem for you then this is the place for great pasta, pizza , seafood. We had scallops and shrimp over linguini with white sauce and split the dish and even brought some home. Large portions. Just too noisy for regular attendance.

data.title: Family friendly food in Carlsbad village
data.text:
Had a lovely dinner with the family at Jay's. The food was divine and the service excellent. The lovely wait staff were very friendly and patient with our small (overexcited, tired and hungry!) children. 

Both the childrens' and adults' meals were decently sized and very yummy. I enjoyed my caprese salad immensely and my husband's shrimp and scallop linguine pasta was amazing! My husband was so impressed with the place that he bought a t-shirt :)

I'd highly recommend Jay's Gourmet Pizza & Seafood if you are looking for a delicious family friendly meal in cute Carlsbad village.

data.title: Can't beat Jay's.
data.text: Can't beat Jay's.  We have been enjoying their Italian seafood for over 20 years, our kids grew up eating Jay's Special, a delicious seafood combination of mussels, clams, king crab, calamari, salmon, halibut over pasta.  Never knew Seafood Pizza until Jay's.  Can't beat Jay's great value, casual atmosphere, and quality.  Love Jay's!

data.title: Goto place every time in town
data.text: excellent Italian food, wine, service, salad, etc. the Service is always great, our server (Elizabeth?) was excellent, suggested wines, and desserts, and perfect service. A nice cozy place in Carlsbad. Dinners are cooked to order. GO there....

data.title: Friday evening dinner
data.text: Excellent Italian cuisine, great service and courteous/friendly staff. Small parking lot, however, if you are strolling in the village of Carlsbad, it is a great place to stop for lunch or dinner.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Finally had some great food on the west coast on our last night. Great pizza and pasta!! Pizza very similar to what you would find on the east coast. Nice little place in Carlsbad village. Definitely recommend it!

data.title: Best food in Carlsbad
data.text:
Love this place & when in Carlsbad always eat here 2-3 times. 
Great, fresh pasta & fish selections daily. The place is cute, but the size of a shoebox. Don't let that fool you. The way this place pumps out food from a closet is amazing in itself. Always busy, outdoor seating available. Love their bread basket & homemade Italian dressing. Wish they would bottle it I'd order a case. 
Bar service, kid friendly, small outdoor seating. Never had a bad meal here.

data.title: nice place
data.text: this is a great place to eat. It's 1 block from the beach so you can take a stroll after dinner. the food is awesome the prices are a little pricey but worth it.

data.title: Always a favorite
data.text: Visited Jay's as we usually do and the consistent quality of the product and service still exists. Have been coming here for over 15 years and it is always a hit. Little overpriced but so is everything else near the beach !

data.title: Wow! Yummy
data.text: I went with friends, a couple, we ordered one order of the Pescatore for $30.00 and shared it. They brought us each a salad to go with our meal.  That one order was more than enough for all three of us. It had crab, shrimp, clams, mussels, calamari and halibut in a yummy white wine garlic sauce with linguini. With your dinner they serve a never ending order of garlic sticks to soak up the sauce. Is your mouth watering yet? It should be! Hurry over there it is great. In fact I'm going again tonight.

data.title: Best seafood salad I've ever had. EVER!
data.text:
Had Mr doggy man with me, so was looking for a nice lunch on a dog friendly patio. I had no idea what I was in store for when I stumbled upon Jay's Gourmet Pizza and Seafood. Pretty easy street parking available even for a busy summer weekend in Carlsbad Village. 

Super laid back dog friendly eatery right near the beach. 

My friendly waitress suggested I try the seafood salad. So I figured I would go with that. And a nice cold 805 to wash it down. 

Wowwww!! This seafood salad was like nothing I have ever eaten before. 
Calamari, shrimp, salmon, scallops over greens with all sorts of other goodies mixed in. It was HANDS DOWN the best, most interesting salad I've ever had. 

I ate every single bite along with a piece of garlic bread. What a dazzling lunch it was. 

Thanks to Jay's for an over the top dining experience. So memorable!

data.title: Dinner
data.text:
Went for dinner with my girlfriend Christina.  The staff was professional and nice, the food was great  - huge portions!  Manage to get a bottle of wine half off on their weekly deal, always a plus :)

I would go again....

data.title: Parking lot eats
data.text: Don't let the location fool you.  People stand in line to enjoy the eats here and don't mind sitting in the parking lot.

data.title: An annual tradition.
data.text:
We spend at least one week every year at our timeshare in Carlsbad, Tamarack Beach Club. And we always have a dinner at Jay's Gourmet. This evening we split the special, sea bass with calamari with a pesto sauce. The portions are generous so splitting is not a problem. Dinner comes with a salad and garlic toast. It was delicious. On previous visits we tried the pizza which is also good.
We sat inside and it is noisy. There are a few tables outside which is much quieter. It's worth a visit when in Carlsbad.

data.title: Great food in a fun little place.
data.text: I always dine at Jay's when at my timeshare, Carlsbad Inn. It's across the street so very convenient and the food is good. I noticed a very strong odor of seafood when I walked in the door this time. I'm allergic to seafood and the smell nauseates me so I ordered my pizza to go. The food is very good but I miss being comfortable dining inside the restaurant.

data.title: You have to go here!
data.text: We have been co I got to Jay's for probably 10+ years, and it never disappoints. The food is amazing and we love the atmosphere.  No doubt it is small, parking is tight, and it is loud inside.  But one bite of their yummy food and you will be back too!

data.title: Good food
data.text: Good choices of seafood entrees and pizza. Quaint interior, tends to be a bit noisy of crowded, so if you're  looking for an intimate setting, this might not be the place. I like the seafood combo.

data.title: Bland food- over priced
data.text:
Not impressed at all by any of it. High price for pesto pasta quality. $30 a plate with no garlic, salt or flavor of any kind. Canned soup, frozen fish. Maybe they just had an off night since reviews are all over the place. 
Lemon Caper sauce was water- lemon wedge on the side and capers. Watered down with no flavor.
